citation.article-title: Actinomyces suimastitidis sp. nov., isolated from pig mastitis
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Actinomyces suimastitidis sp. nov.
Actinomyces suimastitidis (su.i.mas.ti'ti.dis. N.L. sus pig; M.L. n. mastitis infection of the milk glands, N.L. gen. n. suimastitidis of porcine mastitis)
Cells are straight to slightly curved rods which stain Gram-positive, are non-acid-fast and non-motile.
Using API systems acid is produced from D-glucose, L-arabinose (weak), melibiose, pullulan, D-raffinose, ribose (weak), sucrose and D-xylose.
Acid is not produced from D-arabitol, cyclodextrin, lactose, mannitol, melezitose, methyl fD-glucopyranoside, sorbitol, trehalose or tagatose.
Acid may or may not be produced from maltose.
Aesculin is hydrolysed but gelatin and hippurate are not hydrolysed.
Alanine phenylalanine proline arylamidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and pyrazinamidase (weak) are produced.
Arginine dihydrolase, β-glucuronidase, glycyl tryptophan arylamidase, β-mannosidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase and urease are not produced.
Alkaline phosphatase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase may or may not be produced.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
